items.title: Xbox shakeup: Phil Spencer and Sarah Bond are leaving Microsoft

items.title: Figure skating roundup: Shaidorov lands historic gold for Kazakhstan as China holds on with fifth in pairs
items.summary: MILAN, Feb. 20 (Xinhua) -- Mikhail Shaidorov captured Olympic men's single figure skating gold at the Milan-Cortina 2026 Olympic Winter Games, producing a landmark victory for Kazakhstan on a night when traditional powers faltered. For China, in the midst of a difficult rebuilding phase, a hard-earned fifth place in pairs was all they could hold on to. Read full story

items.title: Rijpma-de Jong wins women's 1,500m gold at Milan-Cortina Winter Games (Updated)
items.summary: MILAN, Feb. 20 (Xinhua) -- Antoinette Rijpma-de Jong of the Netherlands finally landed her first Olympic gold medal in her fourth Winter Games as she claimed the title of the women's 1,500 meters speed skating here on Friday. Read full story

items.title: SCOTUS rules Trump’s tariffs are illegal — but the fight is far from over
items.summary: The US Supreme Court struck down some of Donald Trump's tariffs on foreign imports, which have become a hallmark of the chaos of the second Trump administration. The court's ruling deals specifically with duties levied using a law called the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), something no other president has done - the 1977 […]

items.title: Trump furious after Supreme Court upends his global tariffs, vows new 10% levy
items.summary: Feb 20 (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald ⁠Trump responded with fury to Friday's Supreme Court ruling that he did not have the power ⁠to unilaterally set tariffs on imports, denigrating individual justices as he vowed to wield a different law ‌to continue his global trade war. Read full story

items.title: Read Microsoft gaming CEO Asha Sharma’s first memo on the future of Xbox

items.title: Read Xbox chief Phil Spencer’s memo about leaving Microsoft

He also reveals Xbox president Sarah Bond is leaving Microsoft, triggering a big […]

Asha Sharma, currently president of CoreAI product, is taking over as CEO of Microsoft Gaming. Microsoft CEO […]

items.title: Sarah Bond is leaving Xbox

items.title: 1st LD Writethru: U.S. Q4 GDP growth up 1.4 pct, well below estimate
items.summary: WASHINGTON, Feb. 20 (Xinhua) -- U.S. GDP increased at a 1.4 percent annual rate in the fourth quarter of 2025, well below the 2.5 percent growth market analysts had projected, according to data released Friday by the U.S. Bureau of Economic Analysis. Read full story

items.title: Trump is making coal plants even dirtier as AI demands more energy

items.title: Bluetti’s 4-day Member Sale offers up to 53% discounts on power stations + bonus savings – all from $399
items.summary:
Bluetti has launched its February Member Day Sale that will only last for four days and is seeing up to 53% discounts across a selection of power stations and bundles, with special member-only deals for subscribers that save you an additional $100 to $300 over the non-member pricing, as well as bonus savings at certain thresholds. One of the top member-only picks from the lineup is Bluetti’s AC200L Portable Power Station with a 200W solar panel at $1,099 shipped, which sadly can’t stack our exclusive 5% off savings code on top, but is matching the price over at Amazon. You’d normally have to shell out $1,899 for this bundle at full price, with non-members paying an extra $100. This 4-day only deal comes as an $800 markdown off the going rate, landing it down at the third-lowest price we have tracked, though it is the best price we have seen in 2026 so far. You can also grab the standalone power station at $711.55 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5TOYS5OFF at checkout. Head below to see the full lineup of deals while they last.
